marc_display_ss: <record><leader>02550nam a22004333u 4500</leader><controlfield tag="001">14679966</controlfield><controlfield tag="003">SIRSI</controlfield><controlfield tag="005">20151213195112.0</controlfield><controlfield tag="006">m||||||||d|f||||||</controlfield><controlfield tag="007">cr || ||||||||</controlfield><controlfield tag="008">150108e20041214|||     st   f0|| ||eng|d</controlfield><datafield tag="019" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">MARS</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="035" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">(TOE)839816</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="040" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">TOE</subfield><subfield code="c">TOE</subfield><subfield code="d">UtOrBLW</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="072" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">43</subfield><subfield code="2">edbsc</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="086" ind1="0" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">E 1.99:slac-pub-10902</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="088" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">slac-pub-10902</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="245" ind1="0" ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Branching Fractions and CP Asymmetries in B0 to pi0pi0, B+ to pi+pi0 and B+ to  K+pi0 Decays and Isospin Analysis of the B to pi pi System</subfield><subfield code="h">[electronic resource].</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="264" ind1=" " ind2="1"><subfield code="a">Washington, D.C. :</subfield><subfield code="b">United States. Dept. of Energy. Office of Science,</subfield><subfield code="c">2004.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="264" ind1=" " ind2="2"><subfield code="a">Oak Ridge, Tenn. :</subfield><subfield code="b">Distributed by the Office of Scientific and Technical Information, U.S. Dept. of Energy.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="336" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">text</subfield><subfield code="b">txt</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacontent</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="337" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">computer</subfield><subfield code="b">c</subfield><subfield code="2">rdamedia</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="338" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">online resource</subfield><subfield code="b">cr</subfield><subfield code="2">rdacarrier</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Published through SciTech Connect.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">12/14/2004.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">"slac-pub-10902"</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="500" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Cristinziani, M.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="506" ind1=" " ind2="0"><subfield code="a">Free-to-read</subfield><subfield code="f">Unrestricted online access</subfield><subfield code="2">star</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="513" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Topical;</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="520" ind1="3" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Based on a sample of 227 million B{bar B} pairs collected by the BABAR detector at the PEP-II asymmetric-energy B Factory at SLAC, we measure the branching fraction Β(B° → π°π°) = (1.17 ± 0.32 ± 0.10) x 10⁻⁶, and the asymmetry C{sub π°π°} = -0.12 ± 0.56 ± 0.06. The B° → π°π° signal has a significance of 5.0σ. We also measure Β(B⁺ → π⁺π°) = (5.8 ± 0.6 ± 0.4) x 10⁻⁶, Β(B⁺ → K⁺π°) = (12.0 ± 0.7 ± 0.6) x 10⁻⁶, and the charge asymmetries Α{sub π⁺π°} = -0.01 ± 0.10 ± 0.02 and Α{sub K⁺π°} = 0.06 ± 0.06 ± 0.01. Using isospin relations we find an upper bound on the angle difference </subfield><subfield code=" ">of 35{sup o} at the 90% C.L.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="536" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="b">AC02-76SF00515</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="650" ind1=" " ind2="7"><subfield code="a">Particle Accelerators.</subfield><subfield code="2">edbsc</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="653" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Asymmetry.</subfield><subfield code="a">Isospin.</subfield><subfield code="a">Stanford Linear Accelerator Center.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="710" ind1="2" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Stanford Linear Accelerator Center,</subfield><subfield code="e">researcher.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="710" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">United States.</subfield><subfield code="b">Department of Energy.</subfield><subfield code="b">Office of Science,</subfield><subfield code="e">sponsor.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="710" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">United States.</subfield><subfield code="b">Department of Energy.</subfield><subfield code="b">Office of Scientific and Technical Information,</subfield><subfield code="e">distributor.</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="720" ind1="1" ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Cristinziani, M.</subfield><subfield code="4">aut</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="856" ind1="4" ind2="0"><subfield code="7">0</subfield><subfield code="u">http://www.osti.gov/servlets/purl/839816-diTRXZ/native/</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="949" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Electronic resource</subfield><subfield code="w">ASIS</subfield><subfield code="c">1</subfield><subfield code="i">14679966-1001</subfield><subfield code="l">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="m">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="r">Y</subfield><subfield code="s">Y</subfield><subfield code="t">ONLINE</subfield><subfield code="u">4/2/2015</subfield><subfield code="o">.STAFF. SciTechConnect Math20150106-Particle20150108  20150120</subfield></datafield></record>

Free-to-read Unrestricted online access star Topical; Based on a sample of 227 million B{bar B} pairs collected by the BABAR detector at the PEP-II asymmetric-energy B Factory at SLAC, we measure the branching fraction Β(B° → π°π°) = (1.17 ± 0.32 ± 0.10) x 10⁻⁶, and the asymmetry C{sub π°π°} = -0.12 ± 0.56 ± 0.06. The B° → π°π° signal has a significance of 5.0σ. We also measure Β(B⁺ → π⁺π°) = (5.8 ± 0.6 ± 0.4) x 10⁻⁶, Β(B⁺ → K⁺π°) = (12.0 ± 0.7 ± 0.6) x 10⁻⁶, and the charge asymmetries Α{sub π⁺π°} = -0.01 ± 0.10 ± 0.02 and Α{sub K⁺π°} = 0.06 ± 0.06 ± 0.01. Using isospin relations we find an upper bound on the angle difference  of 35{sup o} at the 90% C.L. AC02-76SF00515 Particle Accelerators. edbsc Asymmetry. Isospin. notes_summary_ssim: Based on a sample of 227 million B{bar B} pairs collected by the BABAR detector at the PEP-II asymmetric-energy B Factory at SLAC, we measure the branching fraction Β(B° → π°π°) = (1.17 ± 0.32 ± 0.10) x 10⁻⁶, and the asymmetry C{sub π°π°} = -0.12 ± 0.56 ± 0.06. The B° → π°π° signal has a significance of 5.0σ.
